DIY Cleaning Solutions: Create your own cleaning solutions using natural ingredients like baking soda, vinegar, lemon juice, and essential oils. For example, mix equal parts baking soda and water to create a paste that can be used as a scrub for kitchen surfaces or a deodorizer for shoes.

Hand Sanitizer: If hand sanitizer is no longer available, use rubbing alcohol and add a few drops of essential oil to make it more pleasant-smelling. Alternatively, you could try making your own hand sanitizer by mixing equal parts rubbing alcohol and water.

Water Filtration: If tap water is no longer safe to drink, invest in a water filtration system or a portable water filter. This will allow you to access clean drinking water even if you don't have access to municipal water sources.
Laundry Detergent: Make your own laundry detergent by combining equal parts washing soda, borax, and liquid castile soap. You can also add a few drops of essential oil for fragrance.

Body Wash: Use a combination of coconut oil, baking soda, and essential oils to create a body wash. Simply mix equal parts coconut oil and baking soda, then add a few drops of your favorite essential oil. This will create a gentle, natural body wash that is free from harsh chemicals.
